learningContent.title: Reusing a topic in the same map

lcInstruction.p: On occasion, youâ€™ll need to use the same topic in more than one location in the same map.
However, to ensure that links and cross-references point to the correct instance of the file, use the copy-to attribute in any <topicref> element that references a common topic file.

If your main map or bookmap references two or more submaps and each of those submaps reference the same topic, you must still use the copy-to attribute in those <topicref> elements. When you generate output, preprocessing pulls all submaps into the main map to create a complete, merged map. The merged map is then used to generate output.
Use the <navtitle>, <linktext>, and <shortdesc> elements to provide unique title and description information for the copied topic:
lcInstruction.pre: <map> ... <topicref href="my_topic.dita"/> <topicref href="my_topic.dita" copy-to="copy_of_my_topic.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>New name for my topic</navtitle> <linktext>New name for my topic</linktext> <shortdesc>Modified information about the copy of the topic.</shortdesc> </topicmeta> </topicref> ... </map>
